ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This opportunity is great for any student interested in forestry. My interest within forestry lies outside of plantation-style timber harvesting but I learned an incredible amount from getting to see this aspect of the industry! It helped to apply concepts and forestry approaches I had been learning throughout the school year.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Well organized and practical. Other than doing it, there is no better way to learn about forestry than to see it in action.

Getting to travel to a location where I had never been and may never get the chance to go again! Mike& Ann have great connections in the South, and all the people/professionals we interacted with were very encouraging and interested in sharing their knowledge with us! Also the food is unbeatable!

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The days were long because they were filled with so many things to see and people to meet. It would have been nice to a bit longer at the end of the day to relax so that we didn't feel like staying up later just to have personal down time before beginning again in the morning.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course is one of the few times that you get to see management practices in action, apart from the School Forests. I think it is vitally important to learn from these professionals, especially in a region of the country that approaches forestry differently from professionals in New England.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: This course came HIGHLY recommended by some second years. They were right, it was a excellent and worthwhile adventure.
I took this course for the opportunity to see a side of forestry that I will not get to experience in my professional life. It was very informative and enjoyable!

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes. I wanted a better understanding of Southern forestry practioes and I got that.
Yes the knowledge gained met my expectations!

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: I highly recommend this course for all MF students especially if you've never worked in the south.
Definitely take it!!!!! The south is a wonderful place to visit and there is so much delicious food to eat!
